title: Student is tasered by police after 'stabbing her female teacher' at Heatley school in Townsville
text:
A teacher has been stabbed by a student at a Queensland primary school in front of terrified young classmates.

The female teacher at Heatley State Primary School in Townsville was allegedly stabbed in the back of her shoulder with a knife about 11.30am on Monday.

The 56-year-old was rushed to Townsville Hospital, along with a the 11-year-old female student who police confirmed was tasered by responding officers.

Either the student or the teacher is loaded into an ambulance on a stretcher after the teacher was stabbed and the 12-year-old girl was tasered by police

'A female teacher has suffered non life-threatening puncture-like stab wound to the shoulder, and it is alleged a student of the school was involved in the incident,' police said.

'Officers gave the girl multiple verbal commands prior to deploying a conductive energy device and taken into custody.'

The school was placed in lockdown as emergency services rushed to the scene.

Worried parents arrived to pick up their children as the news spread, but were reportedly told the students were safe and couldn't be taken away.
description: The female teacher at Heatley State Primary School in Townsville was allegedly stabbed in the shoulder with a knife in front of terrified students before the 11-year-old girl was tasered by police.
authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
